title: Stoffel Epitome
author: Stoffel
description: A Greek epitome of the life of Jesus, structured in narrative chapters and verses, attributed to Stoffel.

title.display: The Annunciation of the Birth of St. John.

Astonishment of Mary. — The Angel Relieves her Anxiety.
The Birth of John the Baptist.
The Angel explains to Joseph the Mysteries of God
The Nativity of Our Lord Jesus Christ.
The Magi with Herod at Jerusalem.
The Child Jesus in the Temple.
John The Baptist in the Desert.
The Preaching of John the Baptist.
Jesus is Tempted in the Desert.
First Passover. — Christ’s Zeal for the Sanctity of the Temple.
The Disciples of Jesus Baptize in Judea. John’s Last Testimony to Jesus.
Jesus at the Well of Jacob.
Jesus Returns to Cana in Galilee.
Jesus in the House of Simon.
Dignity and Duties of the Apostles
The Messengers of John the Baptist
Jesus Cures a Man who had been Sick Thirty Eight Years
Jesus Returns to Galilee, Cures one Possessed, and Answers the Hostile Attacks of the Pharisees
The Parable of the Good and the Bad Fishes
Jesus in the Country of the Gerasens
Jesus Cures Two Blind Men, and Returns a Second Time to Nazareth
The Beheading of John the Baptist
The First Sending of the Apostles
The Apostles Receive Instructions for their Mission
The Miracle of the Loaves and Fishes

Second Passover. — The Woman of Chanaan
Cure of the Deaf and Dumb.
Jesus goes to Jerusalem for the Feast of Tabernacles.
The Sending of the Seventy-two Disciples
The Disciples Return from Their First Mission.
Jesus at the Feast of Tabernacles.
The Cure of the Man Born Blind.
Jesus at the Feast of Dedication.
The Jews Seek to Kill Jesus.
Jesus the Friend of the Little Children.
The Parable of the Ten Talents.
Jesus Curses the Barren Fig Tree.
Jesus Foretells the End of the World.
The Wise and the Foolish Virgins.
Judas Offers Himself to the Jews to Betray Jesus.
Jesus Foretells the Treason of Judas.
Jesus Foretells the Denial of Peter.
The Promise of the Holy Ghost.
Christ's Last Discourse to His Disciples.
Jesus is Led Back to Pilate.
Jesus is Scourged and Crowned with Thorns.
The Heart of Jesus is Pierced.
The Sepulchre is Sealed and Guarded.
The Holy Women at the Sepulchre.
Peter and John at the Sepulchre.
Jesus Appears to the Other Women.
Jesus Appears to Two of His Disciples at Emmaus, and to Peter.
Jesus Appears to All the Apostles and Institutes the Sacrament of Penance.
Jesus Appears at the Lake of Tiberias.
The Supreme Pastorship is Conferred upon Peter.
Matthias is Chosen to Replace Judas.

words.word: THE WORK OF JESUS CONTINUED BY THE HOLY GHOST.

title.display: The Descent of the Holy Ghost.
The Organ of the Holy Ghost, the Church.
